definition[0]: to prepare a book, piece of film etc for printing or broadcasting by removing mistakes or parts that are not acceptable
example[0]: The newspaper edits letters before printing them.
definition[1]: to prepare a book or article for printing by deciding what to include and in what order
example[1]: a collection of essays edited by John Gay
definition[2]: to prepare a film by deciding what to include and in what order
definition[3]: to be responsible for the information that is included in a newspaper, magazine etc
example[2]: She used to edit the Observer.
definition[4]: to make changes to a piece of writing, a film, or a recording in order to improve it and remove any mistakes
example[3]: After you have created and edited a document, you will want to format it.
definition[5]: to be the editor of a newspaper or magazine
example[4]: He edited the magazine from 1999 to 2006.
